channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A 101-year-old runs the largest nutcracker museum in the U.S. Here's a look inside
item.description: Arlene Wagner has been collecting nutcrackers for nearly 50 years. Now, she's got one of the largest collections in the world, housed at the Leavenwor...

item.title: Are we in a recession? Maybe professional Santas can tell us
item.description: Demand for professional Santas and other seasonal workers seems to have cooled. Could that be a sign we're in a recession?

item.title: Trump to address affordability. And, the significance of Indiana's redistricting fight

item.title: Black bear populations are bouncing back. Here's how these Texas towns are coping
item.description: Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.

item.title: A Democrat takes on Trump-backed candidate for Miami mayor in a key Hispanic battleground
ICE arrests of Afghans are on the rise in the wake of National Guard attack, immigration lawyers say
item.description: Immigration lawyers and authorities say arrests of Afghans are on the rise following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Investor letter reveals skyrocketing growth of Waymo’s robotaxi rides
item.description: Six months ago, Waymo disclosed it was providing 250,000 robotaxi rides. But it's grown significantly since, a leaked letter says.

item.title: 2026 Home Price Predictions: The Correction Continues?
item.description: Home prices are about to “bend”…but will they break? The 2026 housing market could be another year of a correction, but how low could we go? Last week...

item.title: Department of Commerce approves Nvidia H200 chip exports to China
item.description: This news comes as a bill was introduced in Congress last week to prevent these exact kinds of chip exports.

item.title: FTC upholds ban on stalkerware founder Scott Zuckerman
item.description: Zuckerman, who used to run the stalkerware apps SpyFone and SpyTrac, claimed the ban is hurting his unrelated business.

item.title: SoftBank and Nvidia reportedly in talks to fund Skild AI at $14B, nearly tripling its value
item.description: Skild AI is developing a hardware-agnostic foundation model for robots that can be customized for various uses.
